Method Detail

reference

public void reference()
Increments this image's reference count. Called by ImageLayerGL to let the image know that it's part of the scene graph. Note that this reference counting mechanism only exists to make more efficient use of texture memory. Images are also used by things like Pattern which does not support reference counting, thus images must also provide some fallback mechanism for releasing their texture when no longer needed (like in their finalizer).

release

public void release()
Decrements this image's reference count. Called by ImageLayerGL to let the image know that may no longer be part of the scene graph.

setRepeat

public void setRepeat(boolean repeatX,
                      boolean repeatY)
Description copied from interface: Image
Configures whether this image repeats in the x or y direction (rather than scaling) when used in a layer whose width or height is larger or smaller than the image. Both axes default to false.

Specified by:
setRepeat in interface Image

setMipmapped

public void setMipmapped(boolean mipmapped)
Description copied from interface: Image
Configures the use of mipmaps when rendering this image at scales less than 1. This only applies to GL-based backends (it is a NOOP on other backends).

Specified by:
setMipmapped in interface Image

Parameters:

sy - the y offset (in pixels) of the subimage.
swidth - the width (in pixels) of the subimage.
sheight - the height (in pixels) of the subimage.

toPattern

public Pattern toPattern()
Description copied from interface: Image
Creates a Pattern that can be used to use this image as a fill in a canvas. This pattern will repeat based on the image's repeat configuration.

Specified by:
toPattern in interface Image

getRgb

public void getRgb(int startX,
                   int startY,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   int[] rgbArray,
                   int offset,
                   int scanSize)
Description copied from interface: Image
Extracts pixel data from a rectangular area of this image. This method may perform poorly, in particular on HTML and Flash platforms - avoid using this if possible. The returned pixel format is (alpha << 24 | red << 16 | green << 8 | blue), where alpha, red, green and blue are the corresponding channel values, ranging from 0 to 255 inclusive.

Specified by:
getRgb in interface Image
Parameters:
startX - x-coordinate of the upper left corner of the area.
startY - y-coordinate of the upper left corner of the area.
width - width of the area.
height - height of the area.
rgbArray - will be filled with the pixel data from the area
offset - fill start offset in rgbArray.
scanSize - number of pixels in a row in rgbArray.

transform

public Image transform(Image.BitmapTransformer xform)
Description copied from interface: Image
Generates a new image from this image's bitmap, using a bitmap transformer created for the platform in use. See JavaBitmapTransformer and IOSBitmapTransformer. This does not work on sub-images nor SurfaceImages.

Specified by:
transform in interface Image
